channel.title: Standard Tools on Huy Le
channel.description: Recent content in Standard Tools on Huy Le

item.title: Linux Standard Tools
item.description: Standard Tools Grep grep for files with lines greater than 500 chars grep -Er --include \*.h --include \*.cpp '^.{500,}' . find Moving Around Screen To start screen with a name, and detached in the background screen -dmS <screensession> <command> To attach to a screen, we’ll need to run screen -DRx <screensession> This command will detach the current screen session anywhere else, and attach it to the current terminal.

item.title: Flask 101
item.description: Run through this tutorials Wide range of resources http://mattupstate.com/blog/how-i-structure-my-flask-applications/ https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-structure-large-flask-applications https://www.fullstackpython.com/flask.html http://igordavydenko.com/talks/dneprpy-2/#slide-2 “Microframework for Python” Extensions Extensions in Flask is named Flask_ There are a couple of ways that the extension can be initiated Simple Method This simple method initiate the extension with the flask core app. the extension is exposed and can be used with others. # settings.py SQLALCHEMY_SCHEMA_URI = 'postgresql://username:password@host:port/database' # app.py from flask import Flask from flask.

item.title: Learning SSH
item.description: What is SSH It is probably one of the most useful tools I have come to learn. Secure Shell is a protocol that allows data to be transferred securely between client and server. Typically, the client (typically is you) to log onto a server (another computer) remotely. uses a pair of private and public keys. These keys can be generated by a SSH key generator. There are different levels of security.
